WRITING.TEXT:
I've never commented on this sub before but I'm quite intrigued about this situation.
For background, I'm a white male living in the U.K. I do not believe in any higher deity/power, but believe that religious text holds honourable values that everyone should live by (being good to your neighbour, loving one another). Jesus did not need to be a deity in order to be a good man.
Take the lessons you have learnt, but love your life. Your god is a loving one, and as one of his children he would want you to love your life. You do not need to do anything you are unhappy with. This is more than just a relationship issue, it's your mental health. Be happy bro, you do you. Remember, you always have a choice.

I'm a big fan of this line up, sad Kodja isn't there though!
We could really do damage to the shitty here. Beating them today and losing against Blackburn could actually put them in the relegation area for the last day. I hate losing, but if it sees them go into League 1 then I really don't care! UTV
You actually just made my day! Take your upvote good sir!

Might not have had the possession we wanted but the points speak for themselves. We have an absolutely brilliant run of form and this is setting us up for a wonderful finish to what started an awful season.
The future does seem bright, finally. UTV
Ps - so glad ipswich scored!! Fuck Birmingham Shitty
Thank you :)! I did my bulk and got to 74 kg (~164lbs?) at 5'11" so I'm happy with my weight now. Just want to generally maintain and start lifting heavier now
Thank you! Is there a way to calculate body fat %?
Ah thank you :) will do!
Thank you! Was unsure as most just ask for generic moderate, high or low which each person may determine differently. Thanks for the reply :) will keep looking!
Thank you! Was struggling till I realised I could import it to google sheets. Going to try and save it so I can use it often! Thanks :)

WRITING.TITLE: TDEE - Noob Questions!
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello Fittit!
Since I've gained the weight I've always wanted, I now want to be more careful on my calorie intake. However, I am unsure how TDEE works and I'm hoping one of you lovely people could help Me?
I know TDEE is daily expenditure, and on many calculators it's a rough estimate. On here I found the 2suns TDEE calculator which advised me I expend around 2200-2300 calories (based on 74kg body weight) on the spreadsheet.
Now; how does this interact with exercise? 2suns did an AMAZING set of workouts that include volume and strength in all barbell exercises and I'm assuming this will burn a lot of calories. I want to eat in 100 calorie surplus to maintain my body weight and ensure I'm atleast above what I need.
Could anyone advise on how TDEE works and generally how many extra calories I'd need for roughly 1 hour of barbell exercises?
Thanks in advance!
Thank you! :)
Cheers for the input lad!
Thank you! Means a lot :)
Thank you my friend, means a lot!

Thank you! Life is a journey that never stops! You've just got to keep going! The media really does a bad job of portraying "health". It's all relative. Keep doing what your body wants you to do, that's all you can do!
She's very hot indeed! Thank you :)

Thank you! I thought if people kindly take time out of their day to reply to me, the least I can do is reply to them! :) I haven't no! Something I should consider :) thank you again for the kind words :)
Thank you! :)
Eat big, lift big, sleep big!! You've got this! And thank you :)
Thank you!
Thank you!
Thank you! You can help her through this, be her rock bro :)
Thank you my friend!
Thank you! Was more mental strength than physical! The second one came in time though!
I think the hardest bit for me was the squats. Holding the weight on my back I kept telling myself I couldn't do it!
